title: using an s3 bucket as a common data source

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
#### What is the problem?
I am attempting to setup a cloud resource as a common data source for a git-annex repository as described in the Datalad [demo](https://www.datalad.org/for/data-publication). Instead of box.com I would like to use an s3 bucket. My attempts are failing.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```
# Setup a datalad repo
datalad create demo
cd demo
datalad run dd if=/dev/urandom of=big.dat bs=1000000 count=1  
datalad save

# Setup a bucket for storing binaries (aws keys configured already)
bucket=s3test
git annex initremote $bucket type=S3 chunk=1MiB encryption=none public=yes

# while the demo uses url in the initremote command, here we have to get the public url separately
# url=https://s3test<uuid>.s3.amazonaws.com
git annex enableremote $bucket publicurl=$url
github_repo=test_$bucket
datalad create-sibling-github --publish-depends $bucket --access-protocol ssh $github_repo
datalad publish --to github --transfer-data all
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
datalad 0.12.0rc4 on OSX
#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
I'm note sure what type of remote this is supposed to be but the error I get seems to be attempting to use the bucket as a git repository. The error given is:

No option 'url' in section: 'remote "s3test"' [configparser.py:get:792] (NoOptionError)

[ERROR  ] Remote 's3test' has no refspec set.
| You can set it as follows: 'git config --add "remote.s3test.fetch +refs/heads/*:refs/heads/*"'. [remote.py:_assert_refspec:747] (AssertionError)

It appears the above error can be avoided (though this may not be the correct path forward) by running the command:
`git config --add remote.s3annextest.fetch '+refs/heads/*:refs/heads/*'`

This leads to the error:
```
 [ERROR  ] Cmd('git') failed due to: exit code(128)
 |   cmdline: git -c receive.autogc=0 -c gc.auto=0 fetch --progress -v s3annextest
 |   stderr: 'fatal: repository 'https://s3annextest-de6985aa-e830-40bf-b43b-5991fdc9dabd.s3.amazonaws.com/' not found' [cmd.py:wait:415] (GitCommandError)
```
